meanings.definition: The element of a person that enables them to be aware of the world and their experiences.
meanings.sent1: Her mind was filled with thoughts of the upcoming adventure.
meanings.sent2: She used her mind to solve the puzzle.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't make up his mind about which ice cream flavor to choose.
meanings.sent4: The idea lingered in her mind like a stubborn shadow.
meanings.sent5: His mind was like a sponge, absorbing every detail of the story.

meanings.definition: The ability to think, reason, and make decisions.
meanings.sent1: Using his mind, he came up with a clever solution.
meanings.sent2: Critical thinking is an important aspect of the mind.
meanings.sent3: Her mind was like a well-oiled machine, processing information quickly.
meanings.sent4: The mind is a powerful tool that shapes our choices.
meanings.sent5: In his mind, he could see the path to success clearly.

meanings.definition: Pay attention to; take care of.
meanings.sent1: Please mind your manners at the dinner table.
meanings.sent2: She reminded him to mind the fragile vase while moving it.
meanings.sent3: He decided to mind his own business and not interfere.
meanings.sent4: The teacher asked the students to mind their behavior during the field trip.
meanings.sent5: If you mind the details, you'll avoid mistakes in your work.
